sen.j: この場所にて小栗は武蔵国・相模国の郡代横山のもとにいる美貌の娘である照手姫のことを行商人から聞かされ、文を商人に頼み渡す。
sen.e: In this place, Oguri heard from a peddler about Princess Terute who was a beautiful young woman staying with YOKOYAMA, the administrator of a town in Musashi Province and Sagami Province, and asked the peddler to deliver his letter to her..

sen.j: 照手姫から返事を受け取るや、小栗は10人の家来とともに、照手姫のもとに強引に婿入りする。
sen.e: On receiving a reply from Princess Terute, Oguri went to Princess Terute with ten of his retainers and forced her to have a matrilocal marriage.

sen.j: これを怒った横山によって、小栗と家来達は毒殺され、小栗は上野原で土葬に家来は火葬にされる。
sen.e: YOKOYAMA, who was furious about this, murdered Oguri and his retainers by poisoning, and Oguri was buried in Uenohara and his retainers were cremated.

sen.j: 照手姫は相模川に流され、村君太夫に救われるが、姥の虐待を受けるが千手観音の加護で難を逃れたものの人買いに売り飛ばされ、美濃国青墓の万屋にもらわれ、こき使われる。
sen.e: Princess Terute was banished along Sagami River and then saved by Murakimi Dayu (performer Murakimi) but she was maltreated by the old woman of the house, and though she escaped danger under the protection of Senju Kannon (thousand-armed Buddhist deity of mercy), she was sold off to a human trafficker and then accepted in a general store in Aobaka, Mino Province, where she ended up being exploited.

sen.j: 一方、死んだ小栗と家来は閻魔大王の裁きにより「熊野の湯に入れば元の姿に戻ることができる」との藤沢市の遊行上人宛の手紙とともに現世に送り返される。
sen.e: Meanwhile, dead Oguri and his retainers were sent back to the earthly world together with a letter addressed to Yugyo Shonin (Saint Yugyo) in Fujisawa City saying, 'If they enter the hot spring in Kumano region, they can restore their bodies,' by the ruling of Enma Diao (the Great King Yama).

sen.j: 餓鬼阿弥が小栗の墓から現われたのを見た上人は手紙を読み、小栗を車に乗せると、「この車を引くものは供養になるべし」と胸に木の札に書きしたため多くの人に引かれ美濃の青墓に到着する。
sen.e: Having seen a starving demon emerging from Oguri's tomb, Yugyo Shonin read the letter, put Oguri on a cart, and wrote 'One who pulls this cart will certainly contribute to the repose of the dead' on a wooden tag on his chest, and therefore Oguri was led by many people and reached Aobaka in Mino Province.

sen.j: 常陸小萩の名で働いていた、照手姫は小栗と知らずに5日間に渡って大津まで車を引き、ついに熊野に到着する。
sen.e: Princess Terute, working under the name of Kohagi HITACHI, pulled the cart for five days up to Otsu without knowing that he was Oguri and Oguri arrived at Kumano at last.

sen.j: 熊野・湯の峰温泉の薬効にて49日の湯治の末、完治し元の体に戻ることができる。
sen.e: After taking hot spring cure with the medicinal effects of Yunomine-onsen Hot Spring in Kumano for 49 days, Oguri completely recovered and was able to restore his body.

sen.j: その後、小栗は京都に戻り天皇から死からの帰還は珍事であると称えられ、常陸・駿河・美濃の国を賜ることになる。
sen.e: Later, Oguri returned to Kyoto, where he was praised by the emperor for his surprising return from death and was offered the provinces of Hitachi, Suruga and Mino.

sen.j: また、車を引いてくれた小萩を訪ね彼女が照手姫であることを知り、姫とともに都に上った。
sen.e: Then, visiting Kohagi, who had kindly pulled his cart, Oguri learned that she was Princess Terute, and went up to the capital with her.

sen.j: やがて小栗は横山を滅ぼし、死後は一度死んで蘇生する英雄として美濃墨俣の正八幡（八幡神社 (大垣市墨俣町)）に祀られ､照手姫も結びの神として祀られた。
sen.e: Oguri destroyed YOKOYAMA shortly, and after his death, Oguri was enshrined in Shohachiman (Hachiman-jinja Shrine in Sunomata-cho, Ogaki City) as a hero who revived after death and Princess Terute was enshrined as a god who brings people together.
